posts.name: Amy's Ice Cream - South Congress Ave
posts.note: Amy's Ice Cream is a local chain is serving inventive ice creams, milkshakes, ices and frozen yogurts with clever fixings. They have all kinds of exotic flavors that seem to change all the time. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Café No Sé
posts.note: Café No Sé is a bright spot in the South Congress Hotel for seasonal menus in a chic, rustic-modern space. Café No Sé is an all-day café featuring seasonal breakfast, lunch, and dinner fare, as well as weekend brunch. If you're into burgers, I hear the classic beef cheeseburger, and the shrimp burger is the best.

posts.name: The Clay Pit
posts.note: The Clay Pit serves classic and updated dishes with over 100 wine selections, plus a happy hour in a brick-walled setting. Clay Pit is a nationally - acclaimed, high-energy, contemporary Indian restaurant located in the historical 'Bertram building' in beautiful downtown Austin.

posts.name: Franklins BBQ
posts.note: Franklins BBQ has long lines form early for brisket, pulled pork and other smoked meats at this lunch-only spot. I consider this the best BBQ in the country. You truly need to get the smoked brisket, smoked turkey, and the hot link sausage along with a few sides.
posts.cptn: An order of beans, brisket, smoked turkey, sausage, and side cole slaw at Franklins BBQ in Austin, TX

posts.name: Fresa's
posts.note: Fresa's is a drive-thru and walk-up Mexican joint doing fire wood-grilled chicken, plus tacos, tortas, and ice cream. You need to order the Achiote and Citrus half chicken. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: G'Raj Mahal Cafe and Lounge
posts.note: G'Raj Mahal Cafe and Lounge is a brick-and-mortar outpost of a former food truck serves Indian fare and has a tented space outdoors. Went with friends and ordered a bunch of dishes to share and pass. The place has a great relaxing atmosphere under canopies and trees lit by Christmas lights.

posts.name: Gourdoughs Doughnuts
posts.note: Gourdoughs Doughnuts has ironic names and unique toppings on fried-dough treats served until late-night from a vintage trailer. They have some of the coolest donuts I have ever had. I've seen a few donuts in my day. I ordered a Heavenly Hash doughnut with marshmallow fluff, chocolate chips, hot fudge icing topped with a fudge brownie. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Gourdough's Public House
posts.note: Gourdough's Public House started from 'humble beginnings as a food trailer' to its current brick-and-mortar iteration on South Lamar, this 'guilty pleasure' is known for eclectic, elaborate, gourmet donuts (both 'sweet and savory'). They come à la carte or with meals like burgers, chicken-fried steak, and even salads; cold 'beers on draft' and 'killer cocktails' round out the menu and boost the 'chill' atmosphere.

posts.name: Güero's Taco Bar
posts.note: Güero's Taco Bar is aån extensive menu, salsa bar and hand-shaken margaritas in a landmark building with a patio. They make some of the best breakfast tacos I have had in the state of Texas.

posts.name: Ironworks BBQ
posts.note: Ironworks BBQ serves Barbecued meats, including signature beef ribs, and specialty sauces in a historic former iron shop. Another wonderful Texas BBQ place in downtown Austin and this one's hidden behind the convention center.

posts.name: Moonshine Patio Bar and Grill
posts.note: Moonshine Patio Bar and Grill is a contemporary comfort food and cocktails in a historic home with a patio. I have never been wrong ordering their pork chop dinner and a side of cornbread.

posts.name: Noble Sandwich Co.
posts.note: Noble Sandwich Co. is a farm-to-table slant applies to big breakfast and lunch in casual, counter-service digs with a patio. You need to order a Smoked Duck Pastrami and a Noble Pig or any of their other gourmet sandwiches, but those two are my favorite.

posts.name: Odd Duck
posts.note: Odd Duck is an upscale eatery doling out locally sourced New American chow and drinks in a contemporary setting. Odd Duck is continuing the philosophy of supporting local farmers, making everything from scratch and working to capture the true craft of cooking in each bite even in the restaurant.

posts.name: P. Terry's Burger Stand
posts.note: P. Terry's Burger Stand is a relaxed option for all-natural beef burgers, shoestring fries, and milkshakes, along with breakfast. P. Terry's offers the freshest quality ingredients you can find served out of a drive-thru window. They are where fresh, all-natural, 'never-ever' beef and chicken became staple items. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Salt Lick BBQ
posts.note: Salt Lick BBQ is a BYOB at this venerable cash-only, BBQ spot with a rustic setting and live music outdoors. You need to drive out the original one in Driftwood in the dry county so don't forget to bring your own beer, etc. You need to get the all-you-can-eat BBQ platter which is brisket, smoked sausages, pork ribs, potato salad, cole slaw, and beans along with bread, pickles, and onions. NOTE: They have multiple locations even one at the airport.

posts.name: Smitty's Market
posts.note: Smitty's Market is an acclaimed BBQ spot is offering meats fresh from the smoker in a no-frills space with communal tables. You will need to order yourself some smoked brisket and Jalapeno sausages along with a few sides so you some veggies now and again.

posts.name: South Congress Cafe
posts.note: South Congress Cafe is known for its Bloody Mary, carrot-cake French toast and daily brunch and dinner in a retro-modern room. They have hardy breakfast items and a great brunch from what others have told me.

posts.name: Stubbs BBQ
posts.note: Stubbs BBQ has beer, brisket and music downtown with a renowned Sunday gospel brunch. Again another can't miss BQQ place that has excellent brisket and sausage in downtown Austin.

posts.name: Ramen Tatsu-ya
posts.note: Ramen Tatsu-ya is a popular noodle house and bar with funky vibe serving classic ramen with many options for topping. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Torchy's Tacos
posts.note: Torchy's Tacos is a local chain is serving Mexican-street-food-style tacos in inventive varieties, including for breakfast. They make some of the best breakfast tacos I have had anywhere in the country. Plus, it's great sitting at picnic tables with others in a gravel parking lot eating with people you don't know at all times of the day. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Via 313 Pizza
posts.note: Via 313 Pizza is a trailer outside the Violet Crown Social Club is known for its square, Detroit-style pies have sauce on top. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Veracruz All Natural Food Truck
posts.note: Veracruz All Natural Food Truck serves their food form a modest trailer with picnic tables for tacos with spit-grilled meats or veggie options. You should order the migas. NOTE: They have two food trucks and two brick and mortar locations.

posts.name: Wu Chow
posts.note: Wu Chow serves Sichuan cuisine and weekend dim sum brunch in a contemporary space. Think they serve a dim sum brunch on the weekends, but you check first before going. Order the chicken boa which li's like a mini chicken.
